utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok, Chandler, Mon, there's only one bananna nut muffin left.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh, I ordered mine first.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah, but I'm, I'm so much faster...

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Give it to me.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Give it to me.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ok, you can have it.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: There you go, enjoy your coffee.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: That was there when I got here.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hey you guys, you will never guess who's coming to New York.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Quick, Phoebe, tell us before he can swallow.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh ok, Ryan, that guy I went out with, who's in the Navy.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: You went out with a guy in the Navy?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah, I met him when I was playing guitar in Washington Square Park. Ryan threw in salt water taffy 'cause he didn't have any change.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, is that when you wrote salt water taffy man?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No. No, he is my submaring guy. He resurfaces like every couple years and we have the most amazing three days together. Only this time he's coming for two weeks. Two whole weeks, which means yay.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: So wait, this guy goes down for like two years at a time?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: That'll teach you to lick my muffin.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hiii.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh no, what happened?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well, I just spoke to Carol. Ben's got the chicken pox.

utterance.speaker: ALL
utterance.content: Oh no.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah, so if you haven't already had it, chances are you're gonna get it.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well I've had it.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, I've had it.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Had it.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Had it.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Well, I've never had it, I feel so left out. Oh look!

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Honey, you made the bed again. I told you, you don't have to do that. This isn't camp.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Ooh, then I guess the panty raid last night was totally uncalled for. Ok, I am going to take a shower and today I will be singing Jim Crochee's Leroy Brown.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Monica... Hey Mon, I have a question. Is Leroy the baddest man in the whole damn town or the fattest man in the whole damn town?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Baddest. Otherwise the song would be Fat Fat Leroy Brown.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: What're you doing?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Just waiting for you sweetie.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Are you remaking the bed?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I'm sorry, I'm sorry. You know what, the way you did it was just fine.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Then, you're redoing it because...

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: If I tell you, you'll think I'm crazy.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: You're pretty much running that risk either way.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ok, you see, the tag shouldn't be at the top left corner, it should be at the bottom right corner.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Oh, well that's not so crazy.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I'm just easing you in.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Oh, alright.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Alright, you see these little flower blossoms? They should be facing up, not down, because, well, the head of the bed is where the sun would be. You don't love me any more do you.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Actually, if it's possible, I love you more.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Really? Wow, well then come on, I wanna show you how to fold the toilet paper into a point.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey, look Joey, I'm just saying if you need something to hold you over, I can get you a job right here as an entry level processor.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: But don't you need experience for a job like that?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: It's not that hard to learn. And as for people realizing you have no idea what you're doing, hey, you're an actor. Act like a processor, people will think you're a processor.

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Hey Chandler, here's this morning's projections.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey thanks. Scott Alexander, Joey Tribbianni. Joey is a uh, fellow processor.

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: No kidding.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh yeah yeah. I process. People want the processing, I'm the one they call.

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Where do you work?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Uhh, well, right now I'm in between things. You know how it is. One day you're processing, the next day you're not so much... processing any more.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I was just telling Joey about the opening in Fleischman's group.

utterance.speaker: SCOTT
utterance.content: Fleischman's group. Whatever you do, don't touch his sandwiches. Ha-ha-ha...

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Ha-ha. Are all you processors dorks?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, this lipstick looks just great on you.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You look fabulous honey, you really do.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah? Are you sure, really.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: You see, you look beautiful. For god sakes, dim the lights.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I, I, I'm hideous.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: It's gonna be ok. Ryan's been under water. He's just gonna be so glad that you don't have barnicles on your butt.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Come in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey baby, I'm back...

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hey Ryan, what's up?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What's goin' on?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Well, no no, you have to stay back. I, I have the pox.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Chicken or small?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Chicken. Which is so ironic considering I'm a vegetarian.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why aren't you at home in bed?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: 'Cause my, my grandmother's never had chicken pox. Please, please tell me you have, 'cause oh my God, I forgot how cute you are.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I'm sorry, I never had 'em.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ohh, ohh.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If I had one wish, it would be to build a time machine, go back to when I was 7, when Jimmy Hauser had the chicken pox. I would grab that kid and rub him all over my face.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah, or you know, you could just wish that I didn't have them now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Can I please see your face?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Nope. You don't want to see a face covered with pox.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Your face could be covered with lochs, I wouldn't care.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: And you hate fish. Oh. That's so sweet, alright. Ok, alright, you can see. This is me... Oh, I am scary.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sorry, the lightning. Lightning was an unfortunate incidence. You look lovely, lovely.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I hate this. 'Cause I tell you, I had the most amazing two weeks planned for us, and almost everything I had in mind, we had to be a lot closer than this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Phoebe, I have spent the last eight months in a steel tube with men, thinking about this moment. I am not gonna let a bunch of itchy spots stand between us.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok, this is the most romantic disease I've ever had.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey, how's the first day goin'?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Pretty good. It's like you said. It's mostly just putting numbers from one column into another column.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well there you go.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey and everbody is so nice. I just had a good talk with that lady with the red hair, Jeannie.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Jeannie, the head of east coast operations Jeannie?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, turns out our kids go to the same school. Small world huh?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Weird world. Your kids?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I figure my character has kids.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ya know there isn't a part of that sentence I don't need explained.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well, see when you're acting you need to think about stuff like that. My character, Joseph the processor guy, has two little girls, Ashley and Brittany. Ashley copies everything Brittany does.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, invisible kids can be that way sometimes.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah. Joseph and his wife, Karen, are thinking of having a third kid... Ya know what? Just did.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Really? Wow. That's some pretty powerful imaginary sperm you must have there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know what makes the itching even worse?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: That you don't stop talking about it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Let's just play, ok. Good, ok. Here we go, double sixes, here we go... Here we go, come to mama, just getting ready to roll the dice...

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What're you doing? Are you scratching?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No. This is what I do for luck, ok.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You're scratching. Give me the dice.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Give me the dice.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No. Here. There. Ooh, double sixes.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We can't scratch. You know we can't, we'll scar.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Uhh, I can't stop thinking about it. It's just so hard. I just wanna grab all these houses and rub 'em all over my body.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Give it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah, come on. You know you want it, you know you want it too, come on. Let's just be bad, it'll feel so good.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh God help me.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Now do me, do my back. Oh come on, harder.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, stop that, stop that right now.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: You know, I might have expected this of you Phoebe, but Ryan, you're a military man.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: You and Milton have to join us on the boat. Karen'll pack a lunch, you'll bring the kids, we'll make a day of it.

utterance.speaker: JEANNIE
utterance.content: Oh, that sounds lovely. We're gonna have to set that up. Oh, I better get back. Hope the baby feels better.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh, thanks, thanks. Bye bye Jeannie.

utterance.speaker: JEANNIE
utterance.content: Bye bye Joey.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: What a phony.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, I'm sure you'll teach her a lesson when she steps off the dock onto nothing. Hey Mr. Douglas.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Sir.

utterance.speaker: MR. DOUGLAS
utterance.content: Uh, listen Bing, I received your memo. So, we're not gonna receive the systems report until next Friday?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well the people in my group wanna spend the holiday weekend with their families.

utterance.speaker: MR. DOUGLAS
utterance.content: I have a family, I'm gonna be here.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah Bing, what's that about?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: It's about cutting my people a little slack, ya know, for morale. Look, if you wanna see some rough numbers, I can get them to you by Wednesday.

utterance.speaker: MR. DOUGLAS
utterance.content: Rough numbers?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: This company was not built on rough numbers. Am I right Mr. Douglas.

utterance.speaker: MR. DOUGLAS
utterance.content: Have the final numbers on my desk by Tuesday.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Uh, if you say so sir.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Joseph's good, isn't he?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, I'm going to kill you.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, hey, I just figure Joseph's the kinda guy that likes to mix it up. Ya know, get in there, ruffle some feathers.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Look, I'm sorry but that's what Joseph does, ok. If you try to pull somethin', he'll call you on it. 'What're you tryin' to pull,' he'll say.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Ooh, duct tape. Was I supposed to bring something too?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: This is for the scratchy twins out there. I taped oven mits to their hands.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: You're strict.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: It's for their own good.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: You know, I like the way you have efficiently folded this tab under. See in a tape emergency you could shave valuable seconds off your time.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Exactly. Oh, I love that I can be totally neurotic around you now. Tell me the truth. Don't you like it better now that everything on your desk is perpendicular?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: If it's not a right angle, it is a wrong angle.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Very good.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You know what. Tomorrow I'm gonna do your clocks.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: You're gonna do what to my clocks.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I'm gonna set them to my time.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Well, I'm confused. I thought we shared time.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No no. See, in my bedroom I set my clock six minutes fast. You wanna know why?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Because it's in a slightly different time zone than the kitchen.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No forget it, I'm not gonna tell you now.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: No come on. Come on tell me.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No. See you don't understand.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No. You don't have any of these cute little obsessive things.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: No that's not true. That is not true.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Alright, well tell me one of yours.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Ok. Ahh. One of my things is, I always separate my sweat socks from my dress socks.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: What if they get mixed up?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Boy I would just uh, I would freak out.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You would not. I can't believe this. I hate this, you're too normal. I can't believe my boyfriend doesn't have a thing. My boyfriend doesn't have a thing.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: See, if anyone overheard that, I didn't come off well.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey. Mr. Douglas is looking for you.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Why? Wh- wh- why is Mr. Douglas looking for me?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: 'Cause he has a strong suspicion that you dropped the ball on the Lender project.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Wha- wh- why, why, why does he suspect that?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Becasue at first he thought it was Joseph. But after he asked Joseph about it, turns out it was you. Anyway, I just thought you should know.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Alright, that's it. Look Joey, I'm sorry, I realize this is the role of a lifetime for ya, and if I could just fire Joseph, I would, but unfortunately that's not possible so I'm gonna have to let both of you go.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: What're you talking about, everybody loves Joseph.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I don't, I hate Joseph, ok. I think he's a brown-nosing suck up.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh yeah. Well you can't fire Joseph. You know why, 'cause he's not in your department.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Alright, ok, alright. So I can't fire Joseph but uh, I can sleep with his wife.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Karen.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah, Karen. I'm thinking about having an affair with her. Oh, you know what? I just did.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Ahh. What the hell are you doing to me man.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh well it's not me, it's my character, Chandy. Yeah the rogue processor who seduces his co-worker's wives for sport and then laughs about it the next day at the water cooler. In fact, I have her panties right there in my drawer.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No freakshow, she's fictional.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Take it easy. If it means that much to you, I'll uh, I'll go find something else.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: It's just that, I, I'm gonna miss Joseph. I liked him. His wife, she was hot.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Can I please take these off? I swear I won't scratch.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: No sorry hon, Monica's orders.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well that wasn't easy.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok, dinner's on.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: And there's a peach cobbler warming in the oven so the plate's gonna be hot but that shouldn't be a problem for you.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Alright you kids, bye now.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE and RYAN
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh look, a low budget puppet show.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: It's such a shame you can't see which finger I'm holding up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wine?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Please.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, I spilled some.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I got it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I must tell you, you look beautiful tonight.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sorry. You look beautiful.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: You know what, that's it, that's it.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Monica, wake up. Monica.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: What's up?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: I thought of a thing.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Yeah. I have to sleep, have to, on this side of the bed.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No honey. You have to sleep on this side of the bed because I have to sleep on this side of the bed.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Or so I would have you believe.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No. Big deal, so you have a side of the bed, everybody has a side of the bed.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Hey come on, you haven't heard my reason yet.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Alright, go on.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Ok, I have to sleep on the west side because I grew up in California and otherwise the ocean would be on the wrong side.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh my God, you're a freak.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Yeah. How 'bout that.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: So uh, Ryan, were you shipping off to?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I really can't say.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: So do you have like any nuclear weapons on board?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I can't say.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well do you get to look through one of those like, those periscope thingys.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I'm sorry, but I can't say.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Wow, it, it's neat learning about submarines.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I better get out of here, I'm gonna miss my flight.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok, I'll walk you out.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Bye Ryan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Pleasure.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: It was nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Take care.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: So do you uh, think we can get you one of those uh, uniform things?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: You like that do ya?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I'll make some calls.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Can you believe how we spent our two weeks together?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Taxi.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh I'm sorry, we're clo-... Hey sailor.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Is this what you had in mind?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: I'll say.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I'm shipping out tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well then uh, we better make this night count. Oh wait, I forgot to turn off the cappucino machine. Anchors away. Oh no no, my purse, my purse, my purse, my purse, my purse, my pu rse. Oh, you know what. I forgot to turn off the bathroom light.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Alright you know, why don't I just meet you upstairs.
